source:
from pyspark.sql.functions import from_json, col
from pyspark.sql.types import StructType, StructField, StringType, IntegerType, DoubleType

# Definitions
# Define the output formats and paths and the table name.
write_format = 'delta'

# Load and save paths
load_path = 'abfss://datasets@ajithrdestinationadls.dfs.core.windows.net/movies'
save_path = 'abfss://datasets@ajithrdestinationadls.dfs.core.windows.net/movies-delta-parquet'

# Tables names
ratings_table = "ratings"
credits_table = "credits"
keywords_table = "keywords"
links_table = "links"
metadata_table = "metadata"

# Clean up load path now
mssparkutils.fs.rm(save_path, True)

spark.sql("DROP TABLE IF EXISTS " + metadata_table)

# Load the data from its source.
metadata_df = spark.read.csv(load_path + "/movies_metadata.csv", header='true', inferSchema='true')

btc_schema = StructType(
    [
        StructField('collection_id', IntegerType(), True),
        StructField('collection_name', StringType(), True),
        StructField('collection_poster_path', StringType(), True),
        StructField('collection_backdrop_path', StringType(), True)
    ]
)

exploded_btc_meta_df = metadata_df.withColumn("belongs_to_collection", from_json("belongs_to_collection", btc_schema))\
                             .select(col('adult'), col('belongs_to_collection.*'), col('budget'), col('genres'), col('homepage'), col('id'), \
                                    col('imdb_id'), col('original_language'), col('original_title'), col('overview'), col('popularity'), \
                                    col('poster_path'), col('production_companies'), col('production_countries'), col('release_date'), \
                                    col('revenue'),col('runtime'),col('spoken_languages'),col('status'),col('tagline'),col('title'),\
                                    col('video'), col('vote_average'), col('vote_count'))
                         

# Write the data to its target.
exploded_btc_meta_df.write \
  .format(write_format) \
  .save(save_path + "/metadata/")

# Create the table.
spark.sql("CREATE TABLE " + metadata_table + " USING DELTA LOCATION '" + save_path + "/metadata/'")

spark.sql("DROP TABLE IF EXISTS " + ratings_table)

ratings_schema = StructType(
    [
        StructField('userId', IntegerType(), True),
        StructField('movieId', IntegerType(), True),
        StructField('rating', DoubleType(), True),
        StructField('timestamp', StringType(), True)
    ]
)

ratings_df = spark.read.csv(load_path + "/ratings.csv", header='true', schema=ratings_schema)
ratings_df.printSchema()
# Write the data to its target.
ratings_df.write \
  .format(write_format) \
  .save(save_path + "/ratings/")

# Create the table.
spark.sql("CREATE TABLE " + ratings_table + " USING DELTA LOCATION '" + save_path + "/ratings/'")

spark.sql("DROP TABLE IF EXISTS " + credits_table)

# Load the data from its source.
credits_df = spark.read.csv(load_path + "/credits.csv", header='true', inferSchema='true')

# Write the data to its target.
credits_df.write \
  .format(write_format) \
  .save(save_path + "/credits/")

# Create the table.
spark.sql("CREATE TABLE " + credits_table + " USING DELTA LOCATION '" + save_path + "/credits/'")

spark.sql("DROP TABLE IF EXISTS " + keywords_table)

# Load the data from its source.
keywords_df = spark.read.csv(load_path + "/keywords.csv", header='true', inferSchema='true')

# Write the data to its target.
keywords_df.write \
  .format(write_format) \
  .save(save_path + "/keywords/")

# Create the table.
spark.sql("CREATE TABLE " + keywords_table + " USING DELTA LOCATION '" + save_path + "/keywords/'")

spark.sql("DROP TABLE IF EXISTS " + links_table)

# Load the data from its source.
links_df = spark.read.csv(load_path + "/links.csv", header='true', inferSchema='true')

# Write the data to its target.
links_df.write \
  .format(write_format) \
  .save(save_path + "/links/")

# Create the table.
spark.sql("CREATE TABLE " + links_table + " USING DELTA LOCATION '" + save_path + "/links/'")
